page.title: 01Friday Bridge - Name
page.content: One suggestion of the derivation of the name Friday Bridge is that the Monks journeyed to this area to meet the Fen fishermen at the vridge and to buy fish for their Friday meal. Another is that the wives met their husbands at the bridge to get their wages on Friday before they could spend it at the pub. The stream, called the Elm Leam that the monks used has been completely filledd in except for a small piece in the village, that is now known as The Cut. It was left as a watering hole ofr the animals and as a supply of water for fighting fires. The cut now contains numerous goldfish.
